page.title: 05FISHING
page.content: The River Test is well known for some of the best trout fishing in the country, and the section which runs through the block is very typical of the river. The river is divided into three stretches of fishing rights owned by three separate concerns Brook stretch _ let by Compton Estate; Lower Brook stretch _ privately owned by local land_owner at Lower Brook; Mottisfont stretch _ owned by Humbert Syndicate. The fishing is mainly for trout with some salmon. The river has been carefully channelled for centuries with fishing in mind and is well managed at the present day, being annually cleared out and restocked, with coarse fish removed. Beats are expensive to rent, fees being between Â£40 and Â£70 per day. Waterfowl on the river are common.
